Use only the EGOTM blade; using any other brand blade could result in serious personal injury.

Blade thrust is a sudden, strong movement of the machine in any direction when the blade jams or catches on something it cannot cut.
Move the lock-off lever forward and then press the trigger switch to start; the motor starts only when both are done at the same time.
Release the trigger to stop the machine.
The rotational speed of the trimmer head is controlled with the trigger switch; more pressure on the trigger results in higher speed, less pressure results in lower speed.

Press the speed mode button; each press changes the speed mode; speed indicator shows active mode with one, two, or three lights for low, medium, or high speed; speed mode can be set before or during operation.

Align the battery ribs with the mounting slots in the machine's battery port and slide the battery pack until it snaps into position.
Depress the battery-release button and the battery pack will disengage from the latch; grasp the battery pack and remove it from the machine; never remove the battery pack at a high location.

Battery charge level of less than 10%
The battery pack charge is nearly depleted and needs to be charged immediately.

The battery pack electronics error; replace the battery pack or contact EGO customer service center.
The machine is overheated; release the trigger and wait until the machine cools down and the speed indicator turns green, then restart the machine.
A flashing orange speed indicator means the machine is overloaded; remove the battery pack, reattach it, restart the machine, and decrease the load.
The battery-status indicator and the speed indicator will illuminate when the machine is started or the speed mode button is pressed.
